page.title: 16Village Life in Gillamoor
page.content: Gillamoor is still a working village, with farms and a small primary school. It has a post-office but no grocer's shop and relies on Kirkbymoorside shops.There is a craft and coffee shop There are about 100 people living in the village, some 50% being retired. Until about 10 years ago,most families had continuously lived in the village, but now about half are'incomers'and only 10% speak with a local accent. There are 5 or 6 farming families here but others work out of the village. Most people enjoy a quiet country life tending their small-holdings and well maintained gardens. Some keep a few hens,a goat,a pig or bees. There is a village carnival in August and the ladies support a thriving WI.The 'Royal Oak' pub has recently been modernised, but is still the "local".
